definition: to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Yao/Yao or Tang Yao (c. 2200 BC), one of Five legendary Emperors 五帝[wu3 di4], second son of Di Ku 帝嚳|帝喾[Di4 Ku4]
to set fire to/to burn down/burning hot/baked cake
to burn paper offerings (as part of religious ceremony)

sentences.english: Minimizes penetration, which may help prevent burn-through on thin materials.
sentences.chinese: 最小渗透，这可能有助于防止烧透过薄材料。

sentences.english: I burnt some joss papers and pray to the examination god.
sentences.chinese: 我烧了一些金纸，祈求上帝的考试。

sentences.english: and burned fragrant incense on it, as the Lord commanded him.
sentences.chinese: 在坛上烧了麝香料做的香，是照耶和华所吩咐他的。

sentences.english: Use a lighter to burn a hole in the middle of each Scindapsus aureus leaf.
sentences.chinese: 把一盆绿萝的叶子中央都用打火机烧一个洞。

sentences.english: The fire, it burned for a long time. Protected them.
sentences.chinese: 火儿烧了好长一段时间，保护着他们。

sentences.english: The incense is going to be finished.
As soon as this was done, they cooked a meal oven an open fire.
sentences.chinese: 这件事刚做完，他们就在篝火上烧起了饭。

sentences.english: Her mother was down with fever yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 她妈妈昨天烧得起不来了。

sentences.english: He is going to scalp me or burn me at the stake.
sentences.chinese: 他要剥掉我的头皮或是在火刑柱上烧我。

sentences.english: I did. There was a blue flash and the set caught alight .
sentences.chinese: 我一打开，蓝光一闪，机子就烧了。

sentences.english: All five-second grenade fuses will burn down in three seconds.
sentences.chinese: 所有用时五秒烧完的手榴弹引线都会在三秒内烧完。

sentences.english: Innovative, yet proven, SolidWorks software is the standard in 3D.
sentences.chinese: 创新至今，证实了烧窝是三维的标准。

sentences.english: You'll have to blow up the fire to make it burn.
sentences.chinese: 你得把火吹旺让它烧起来。

sentences.english: They hung a kettle over the fire.
sentences.chinese: 他们在灶火上方挂了一个烧水壶。

sentences.english: His house gor burned down but he soon got over the tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 他家房子烧了，不过他很快就从这一悲剧中振作起来。

sentences.english: He had nothing to do but boil the kettle and make the tea.
sentences.chinese: 他除了烧开水和沏茶以外无事可做。

definition: to set fire to/to burn down/burning hot/baked cake
to have a fever reaching (a certain temperature)
to discharge smoke/to fume with rage
to light a fire for cooking
to make a fire/to light a fire
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
